alert.note: Alert for Kingman; Sedgwick; Sumner (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 12 at 11:02PM CDT by NWS Wichita
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Sedgwick, eastern Harper, southeastern Kingman and northern Sumner Counties through MIDNIGHT CDT... At 1100 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorm outflow winds along a line extending from near Park City to 8 miles north of Harper. The movement of these outflow winds was spreading southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts 40 to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Wichita, Derby, Haysville, Park City, Valley Center, Bel Aire, Mulvane, Goddard, Maize, Clearwater, Anthony, Cheney, Belle Plaine, Harper, Colwich, Conway Springs, Garden Plain, Downtown Wichita, Kechi and Andale. This includes the following highways... Interstate 135 between Mile Markers 0 and 17. Interstate 35 between Mile Markers 25 and 53. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 100 AM CDT for south central Kansas.
